commit_message:
Add EndpointMap as output

The endpoint map contains, not only the hosts and protocols that
the resulting services will use, but also the ports. This
information is useful, and the aim of this patch is to make it
available for the tripleoclient to use it.

Change-Id: I4cc5bbf2e7200f78cd90b93659c326a9200278d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/73/299473/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Correct the 'Admin User Guide' name

Since Mitaka reorganised the Admin User Guide content together with the
Cloud Admin Guide content to create a new Administrator Guide. So this
patch correct the 'Admin User Guide' to 'Administrator Guide'. Refer to
'http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/openstack-manuals/mitaka.html#user-guides'

Change-Id: Ib881b7b8df26a9928fc834897538e480542494cd

commit_message:
libvirt: pci detach devices should use dev.address

The _detach_pci_devices gets pci_devs which is list
of PciDevice objects. The code that check if pci is
detach is using dev['address'] and as not in the obj
format dev.address.

Closes-Bug: #1565466

Change-Id: I9ba58707d03d19018a025d7760f2a77f84d23aad
(cherry picked from commit 871368bc65eb9ededd053055c35673dbb61dd3ad)

commit_message:
Rely on skip_identical to skip identical objects

Swift Service has the ability to skip identical objects. Use it instead
of not using it.

Change-Id: I1459c79a45d9bcd0de4d1e6d20910a7ef16c785e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/99/303199/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: use_slo=True, skip_identical=True, :param md5: Unused. Present for backwards compat :param sha256: Unused. Present for backwards compat :param skip_identical: Don't attempt to upload objects that already exist. (optional, defaults to True) self.log.debug( "swift uploading {filename} to {container}/{name}".format( filename=filename, container=container, name=name)) upload = swiftclient.service.SwiftUploadObject( source=filename, object_name=name, options=dict( header=header_list, segment_size=segment_size, skip_identical=True, use_slo=use_slo)) for r in self.manager.submitTask(_tasks.ObjectCreate( container=container, objects=[upload])): if not r['success']: raise OpenStackCloudException( 'Failed at action ({action}) [{error}]:'.format(**r))
deleted_lines: use_slo=True, :param md5: A hexadecimal md5 of the file. (Optional), if it is known and can be passed here, it will save repeating the expensive md5 process. It is assumed to be accurate. :param sha256: A hexadecimal sha256 of the file. (Optional) See md5. if not md5 or not sha256: (md5, sha256) = self._get_file_hashes(filename) headers[OBJECT_MD5_KEY] = md5 headers[OBJECT_SHA256_KEY] = sha256 if self.is_object_stale(container, name, filename, md5, sha256): self.log.debug( "swift uploading {filename} to {container}/{name}".format( filename=filename, container=container, name=name)) upload = swiftclient.service.SwiftUploadObject( source=filename, object_name=name, options=dict( header=header_list, segment_size=segment_size, use_slo=use_slo)) for r in self.manager.submitTask(_tasks.ObjectCreate( container=container, objects=[upload])): if not r['success']: raise OpenStackCloudException( 'Failed at action ({action}) [{error}]:'.format(**r))

commit_message:
Make the Django 1.9 tests voting on OpenStack Auth

The Django 1.9 tests have been passing for a long time on Django
OpenStack Auth. We should make them voting to prevent any
regression.

Change-Id: I9561da17560274ac646d40151ee9d13d8774dd5b

""%(workers)d 의 %(worker_name)s 값이 올바르지 않습니다. 이 값은 0보다 커야 합" "니다."msgstr "%s이(가) 문자열 또는 유니코드가 아닙니다"msgstr "%s 은(는) 정수여야 합니다."msgstr "'consistencygroup_id' 를 지정해야 함"msgstr "'status' 가 지정되어야 합니다."msgstr "'volume_id' 를 지정해야 함"msgstr "API 버전 %(version)s 에서는 이 메서드를 지원하지 않습니다.."msgstr "백업 동작 중에 오류가 발생함 "msgstr "백엔드가 존재하지 않습니다 (%(backend)s)"msgstr "백엔드 서비스 재시도 제한시간 도달: %(timeout)s 초"msgstr "백업 RBD 동작이 실패함 "msgstr "백업 드라이버가 오류를 보고하였습니다: %(message)s"msgstr "암호화된 볼륨에 대한 백업 동작이 실패했습니다.""이름이 %(name)s이고 스펙이 %(extra_specs)s 인 volume_type을 작성할 수 없음""소스에서 일관성 그룹 %(name)s 을(를) 작성하는 데 필요한 'cgsnapshot_id' 와 " "'source_cgid' 를 모두 제공할 수 없습니다. "msgstr "volume_type %(id)s 을(를) 업데이트할 수 없음"msgstr "CgSnapshot %(cgsnapshot_id)s 을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "해당 변경으로 인해 %(unders)s 자원의 사용량이 0보다 적게 됩니다. "msgstr "Swift 연결에 실패하였습니다: %(reason)s"msgstr "ConsistencyGroup %(consistencygroup_id)s 을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "조정자가 초기화되지 않았습니다."msgstr "%(path)s 에서 구성을 찾을 수 없음"msgstr "%(path)s에서 paste app '%(name)s'을(를) 로드할 수 없음""%(res)s 자원에 대한 기본 할당량은 기본 할당량 플래그 quota_%(res)s 에 의해 설" "정됩니다. 이제 해당 플래그는 더 이상 사용되지 않습니다. 기본 할당량에 기본 할" "당량 클래스를 사용하십시오."msgstr "이름이 %(vol_name)s 인 둘 이상의 볼륨을 발견했음""EMC VNX Cinder 드라이버 CLI 예외: %(cmd)s (리턴 코드: %(rc)s) (출력: " "%(out)s).""EMC VNX Cinder 드라이버 SPUnavailableException: %(cmd)s (리턴 코드: %(rc)s) " "(출력: %(out)s).""소스에서 일관성 그룹 %(name)s 을(를) 작성하려면 'cgsnapshot_id' 또는 " "'source_cgid' 를 제공해야 합니다. "msgstr "SolidFire API 응답의 오류: data=%(data)s"msgstr "%(service)s API를 요청하는 도중 오류가 발생했습니다."msgstr "볼륨당 스냅샷에 대한 제한을 초과하였습니다"msgstr "uuid를 예상했지만 %(uuid)s 을(를) 수신했습니다. "msgstr "cgsnapshot 실패"msgstr "" "qos_specs %(specs_id)s 을(를) %(type_id)s 유형과 연관시키지 못했습니다."msgstr "볼륨 그룹을 작성할 수 없습니다: %(vg_name)s""%(qos_specs)s 스펙을 가진 qos_specs %(name)s 을(를) 작성하지 못했습니다. ""qos_specs %(specs_id)s 을(를) %(type_id)s 유형과 연관 해제시키지 못했습니다. "msgstr "볼륨에 대한 내보내기가 실패하였습니다: %(reason)s"msgstr "볼륨 백엔드 식별을 실패했습니다.""%(qos_specs)s 스펙을 가진 qos_specs %(specs_id)s 을(를) 업데이트하지 못했습니"msgstr "파이버 채널 구역 동작 실패: %(reason)s""Glance 메타데이터를 업데이트할 수 없음. 볼륨 ID %(volume_id)s 에 대해 " "%(key)s 키가 있음"msgstr "%(id)s 볼륨/스냅샷에 대한 Glance 메타데이터를 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "%(image_id)s 이미지는 허용되지 않습니다: %(reason)s""Infortrend CLI 예외: %(err)s 매개변수: %(param)s (리턴 코드: %(rc)s) (출력: "msgstr "올바르지 않은 3PAR 도메인입니다: %(err)s"msgstr "백업 rbd 동작에 올바르지 않은 Ceph 인수가 제공됨 "msgstr "올바르지 않은 CgSnapshot: %(reason)s"msgstr "올바르지 않은 ConsistencyGroup: %(reason)s"msgstr "볼륨 %(volume_id)s 에 대한 연결 모드 '%(mode)s' 가 올바르지 않습니다."msgstr "올바르지 않은 인증 키: %(reason)s"msgstr "올바르지 않은 cgsnapshot"msgstr "올바르지 않은 호스트: %(reason)s"msgstr "올바르지 않은 입력을 받음: %(reason)s"msgstr "올바르지 않은 메타데이터 크기: %(reason)s"msgstr "올바르지 않은 메타데이터: %(reason)s""'rw' 또는 'ro' 여야 합니다. "msgstr "올바르지 않은 예약 만료 %(expire)s."msgstr "올바르지 않은 스냅샷: %(reason)s"msgstr "강제 실행에 대한 올바르지 않은 값 '%s' 입니다. ""is_public에 대해 값 '%s' 이(가) 올바르지 않습니다. 허용 값: True 또는 False."msgstr "skip_validation에 대한 값 '%s' 이(가) 올바르지 않습니다. "msgstr "'bootable' 에 대한 값이 올바르지 않음: '%s'"msgstr "'force' 에 대해 값이 올바르지 않음: '%s'"msgstr "'readonly' 에 대한 값이 올바르지 않음: '%s'"msgstr "올바르지 않은 볼륨 유형: %(reason)s"msgstr "올바르지 않은 볼륨: %(reason)s"msgstr "잠금 획득에 실패했습니다."msgstr "%(cmd)s 명령어에 대한 손상된 응답: %(reason)s""올바르지 않은 백엔드 참조 %(existing_ref)s 로 인해 기존 볼륨 관리를 실패하였" "습니다: %(reason)s"msgstr "허용된 최대 백업 수(%(allowed)d) 를 초과함"msgstr "허용된 최대 스냅샷 수 (%(allowed)d) 을(를) 초과함""할당량 '%(name)s' 에 대해 허용된 최대 볼륨 수(%(allowed)d) 를 초과하였습니" "다. "msgstr "요청 본문에서 필수 요소 '%s' 이(가) 누락되었습니다. "msgstr "요청 본문에 필수 요소 'consistencygroup' 이 누락되었습니다. "msgstr "요청 본문에 필수 요소 'host' 가 누락되었습니다. "msgstr "'connector' 를 지정해야 함"msgstr "'connector' 를 지정해야 합니다. "msgstr "'host' 를 지정해야 합니다. "msgstr "'new_volume' 을 지정해야 함"msgstr "'status' 를 지정해야 함""요청 본문에서 이름, 설명, add_volumes 및 remove_volumes이 모두 비어 있을 수 " "없습니다. "msgstr "NetApp Cinder 드라이버 예외."msgstr "제공된 iSCSI IP를 가진 활성 iSCSI 포털이 없습니다"msgstr "마운트된 공유를 찾을 수 없습니다"msgstr "해당하는 QoS 스펙 %(specs_id)s 이(가) 없습니다. "msgstr "유효한 호스트를 찾지 못했습니다. %(reason)s"msgstr "백엔드(%(backend)s) 에 공간이 충분하지 않습니다""%(value)s %(verb)s 요청만이 %(unit_string)s 마다 %(uri)s 에 적용될 수 있습니"msgstr "" "동작 실패가 status=%(status)s 과(와) 함께 발생하였습니다. 전체 덤프: %(data)s"msgstr "동작이 지원되지 않음: %(operation)s."msgstr "정책이 %(action)s 이(가) 수행되도록 허용하지 않습니다. "msgstr "" "중첩된 할당량에 맞게 프로젝트 할당량이 설정되지 않았습니다: %(reason)s."msgstr "QoS 스펙 %(specs_id)s 이(가) 엔티티와 연관되어 있습니다. "msgstr "QoS 스펙 %(specs_id)s 에 %(specs_key)s 키를 갖는 스펙이 없습니다. ""하십시오."msgstr "할당량을 초과하였습니다: code=%(code)s""'%(res)s' 자원의 프로젝트 '%(proj)s' 에 대한 할당량 한계가 올바르지 않습니" "다: %(limit)d 의 한계가 사용 중인 값 %(used)d 보다 적습니다""%(requested)sG 이고 할당량은 %(quota)sG 이며 %(consumed)sG 가 이용되었습니다.""%(requested)sG 이고 할당량은 %(quota)sG 이며 %(consumed)sG 가 사용되었습니다.""요청된 볼륨 크기 %(size)d 이(가) 허용된 최대 한계 %(limit)d 보다 큽니다. "msgstr "재현 가능한 SolidFire 예외가 발생하였습니다"msgstr "SSH 명령 인젝션이 발견되었습니다: %(command)s"msgstr "스케줄러 호스트 필터 %(filter_name)s 을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "스케줄러 호스트 Weigher %(weigher_name)s 을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "호스트 %(host)s 에서 서비스 %(service_id)s 을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다."msgstr "서비스가 너무 오래되어 해당 요청을 수행할 수 없습니다."msgstr "서비스가 현재 사용 불가능합니다. ""표시 동작은 사용자가 범위 지정되는 프로젝트의 동일한 계층에 있는 프로젝트에 ""update_snapshot_status에 대해 스냅샷 상태 %(cur)s 이(가) 허용되지 않습니다. ""하위 사용량 합계 '%(sum)s' 이(가) '%(res)s' 자원의 '%(proj)s' 프로젝트에 사" "용 가능한 할당량 '%(free)s' 보다 큽니다. 하나 이상의 '%(child_ids)s' 프로젝트" "에 대한 한계 또는 사용량을 낮추십시오."msgstr "시스템이 사용 중입니다. 동작을 재시도하십시오. ""템플릿 트리가 일치하지 않습니다. 슬레이브 %(slavetag)s 에 대한 마스터 " "%(mastertag)s 로의 추가"msgstr "테넌트 ID: %s 이(가) 존재하지 않습니다. ""'sort_key' 와 'sort_dir' 매개변수는 더 이상 사용되지 않는 항목이므로'sort' 매""%(src)s, 대상 볼륨: %(dst)s, 메서드: %(method)s."msgstr "경로 %(path)s에 있는 장치를 사용할 수 없습니다: %(reason)s""볼륨/스냅샷 %(id)s 에 대한 메타데이터의 유형: %(metadata_type)s 이(가) 올바르"msgstr "%(volume_size)sG 를 호스트할 수 있는 공유가 없습니다"msgstr "%(volume_size)sG 를 호스트할 수 있는 공유가 없습니다."msgstr "%(service)s API를 요청하는 도중 제한시간을 초과했습니다."msgstr "" "백엔드 %(service)s 에서 기능을 요청하는 동안 제한시간을 초과하였습니다."msgstr "전송 %(transfer_id)s 을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "복제 대상으로 장애 복구할 수 없음: %(reason)s)."msgstr "백엔드에서 연결 정보를 가져올 수 없습니다."msgstr "볼륨 그룹을 찾을 수 없습니다: %(vg_name)s"msgstr "Solidfire 장치에서 %(account_name)s 계정을 찾을 수 없습니다""기존 볼륨을 관리할 수 없습니다. 볼륨 %(volume_ref)s 이(가) 이미 관리되고 있습"msgstr "알 수 없거나 지원되지 않는 명령어 %(cmd)s"msgstr "알 수 없는 할당량 자원 %(unknown)s 입니다."msgstr "지원하지 않는 백업 메타데이터 버전이 요청됨"msgstr "지원하지 않는 백업 검증 드라이버입니다""할당량 업데이트 및 삭제 동작은 직속 상위의 관리자 또는 CLOUD 관리자만 작성할 ""할당량 업데이트 및 삭제 동작은 사용자가 범위 지정되는 프로젝트의 동일한 계층"msgstr "사용자에게 관리자 권한이 없습니다"msgstr "" "값 "%(value)s"이(가) 구성 옵션 "%(option)s" 에 대해 올바르지 않습니다"msgstr "%(param_string)s 에 대한 값 %(param)s 이(가) 부울이 아닙니다. "msgstr "볼륨 %(volume_name)s 을(를) 사용 중입니다."msgstr "볼륨 유형 %(type_id)s 에 키 %(id)s 을(를) 가진 추가 스펙이 없습니다. ""볼륨 유형 %(volume_type_id)s 에 대한 삭제는 해당 유형을 가지고 있을 경우에 허" "용하지 않습니다."msgstr "볼륨 유형 ID는 None이 아니어야 합니다. "msgstr "%(filter)s 필터로 볼륨 연결을 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "%(device)s 에서 볼륨 장치를 찾을 수 없습니다."msgstr "볼륨 드라이버가 준비되지 않았습니다."msgstr "볼륨 드라이버가 오류를 보고하였습니다: %(message)s"msgstr "%(volume_id)s 의 볼륨 복제를 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "Initiator 그룹에 대한 볼륨 맵핑이 이미 존재합니다"msgstr "이름이 %(volume_type_name)s 인 볼륨 유형을 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "볼륨 ID가 %s 인 볼륨이 존재하지 않습니다. "msgstr "볼륨: %s 을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다. "msgstr "키 관리자 오류: %(reason)s"msgstr "마커 [%s] 을(를) 찾을 수 없음"

subject: libvirt: Allow use of live snapshots with RBD snapshot/clone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-28 16:57:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b3ecf245b5c45344258bee91f248c4e33bd32e37', 'message': 'Allow use of live snapshots with RBD snapshot/clone

The recently merged functionality for making use of RBD
snapshot/clone when available is very valuable for the
Ceph/RBD users out there. However, it also enables the
use of live instance snapshots with Ceph/RBD.

This patch enables the use of live instance snapshots
when RBD snapshot/clone is performed.

Change-Id: Ic3a3c73898aa868d6c510639ab12d2401dcb5001
Closes-Bug: #1539179
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-05 14:23:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d522535597f121132725f383cd6314abcd5f068e', 'message': 'Allow use of live snapshots with RBD snapshot/clone

The recently merged functionality for making use of RBD
snapshot/clone when available is very valuable for the
Ceph/RBD users out there. The new method also makes it
possible to do live instance snapshots with Ceph/RBD.
However, the current code explicitly forbids it.

This patch allows the use of live instance snapshots
when a RBD snapshot/clone is performed directly, and
reverts back to cold instance snapshot when the old
method is used.

Change-Id: Ic3a3c73898aa868d6c510639ab12d2401dcb5001
Closes-Bug: #1539179

This patch allows the use of live instance snapshots

This patch allows the use of live instance snapshots when a RBD
snapshot/clone is performed directly, and reverts back to cold
instance snapshot when the old method is used.

commit_message:
libvirt: Allow use of live snapshots with RBD snapshot/clone

The recently merged functionality for making use of RBD snapshot/clone
when available is very valuable for the Ceph/RBD users out there.
The new method also makes it possible to do live instance snapshots
with Ceph/RBD.  However, the current code explicitly forbids it.

This patch allows the use of live instance snapshots when a RBD
snapshot/clone is performed directly, and reverts back to cold
instance snapshot when the old method is used.

Co-Authored-By: Nicolas Simonds <nic@metacloud.com>
Change-Id: Ic3a3c73898aa868d6c510639ab12d2401dcb5001
Closes-Bug: #1539179

added_lines: and source_type not in ('lvm') # Standard snapshot uses qemu img-convert from RBD which is not # safe to run with live_snapshot. live_snapshot = False

commit_message:
test_migrations: always assume we want to validate scripts with data

There is probably little reason to use the framework without targeting
data migrations, and the with_data argument is always True right now, so
let's just clean that up avoid a bit of bloat code.

Change-Id: I161245c972821b67225a4dfc33a2d4b5739651af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/24/302724/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._migrate_up(config, engine, dest, curr) def _migrate_up(self, config, engine, dest, curr): data = None pre_upgrade = getattr( self, "_pre_upgrade_%s" % dest, None) if pre_upgrade: data = pre_upgrade(engine) check = getattr(self, "_check_%s" % dest, None) if check and data: check(engine, data)
deleted_lines: self._migrate_up(config, engine, dest, curr, with_data=True) def _migrate_up(self, config, engine, dest, curr, with_data=False): if with_data: data = None pre_upgrade = getattr( self, "_pre_upgrade_%s" % dest, None) if pre_upgrade: data = pre_upgrade(engine) if with_data: check = getattr(self, "_check_%s" % dest, None) if check and data: check(engine, data)

revisions:

Downgrades are not supported for a while in Neutron, it's just bloat

Change-Id: I490eab050a47a3953558abee41aa61f795833b24
"}]
commit_message:
tet_migrations: remove code to validate downgrades

Downgrades are not supported for a while in Neutron, it's just bloat
code now.

Change-Id: I490eab050a47a3953558abee41aa61f795833b24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/22/302722/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _revisions(self): revisions = list(reversed(revisions)) # Destination, current yield rev.revision, rev.down_revision def _walk_versions(self, config, engine): """Test migrations ability to upgrade."""
deleted_lines: def _revisions(self, downgrade=False): :param downgrade: whether to include downgrade behavior or not. :type downgrade: Bool if not downgrade: revisions = list(reversed(revisions)) if downgrade: # Destination, current yield rev.down_revision, rev.revision else: # Destination, current yield rev.revision, rev.down_revision def _walk_versions(self, config, engine, downgrade=True, snake_walk=False): """Test migrations ability to upgrade and downgrade. :param downgrade: whether to include downgrade behavior or not. :type downgrade: Bool :snake_walk: enable mode when at every upgrade revision will be downgraded and upgraded in previous state at upgrade and backward at downgrade. :type snake_walk: Bool """ if snake_walk and dest != 'None': # NOTE(I159): Pass reversed arguments into `_migrate_down` # method because we have been upgraded to a destination # revision and now we going to downgrade back. self._migrate_down(config, engine, curr, dest, with_data=True) self._migrate_up(config, engine, dest, curr, with_data=True) if downgrade: revisions = self._revisions(downgrade) for dest, curr in revisions: self._migrate_down(config, engine, dest, curr, with_data=True) if snake_walk: self._migrate_up(config, engine, curr, dest, with_data=True) self._migrate_down(config, engine, dest, curr, with_data=True) def _migrate_down(self, config, engine, dest, curr, with_data=False): # First upgrade it to current to do downgrade if dest: migration.do_alembic_command(config, 'downgrade', dest) else: meta = sqlalchemy.MetaData(bind=engine) meta.drop_all() if with_data: post_downgrade = getattr( self, "_post_downgrade_%s" % curr, None) if post_downgrade: post_downgrade(engine)

commit_message:
Return 400 on boot for invalid image metadata

Horizon allows a free-form input field for architecture
when creating an image. However, the architecture in
the image metadata is validated against nova.compute.arch.ALL
so when converting the image metadata in the compute API
boot validation, if we hit a ValueError we should raise
an appropriate exception so the REST API will return a 400
rather than a 500.

Change-Id: Ib01b4b088fec065c671f83f5912e928b4d7fec71
Closes-Bug: #1558866
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/295395/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(boot_meta) except ValueError as e: # there must be invalid values in the image meta properties so # consider this an invalid request msg = _('Invalid image metadata. Error: %s') % six.text_type(e) raise exception.InvalidRequest(msg)

subject: objects: avoid validation in stringify for custom field types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 12:09:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/common_types.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_common_types.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c2eb7289cbc15acc9a4432103672a385e0a0d0e7', 'message': "objects: avoid validation in stringify for custom field types

stringify() is used only in base __repr__ method for objects, where the
value passed into the method is getattr(self, field_name). Since
validation was already executed when the attribute was set on the object
(in 'coerce'), there is no need to repeat the validation in stringify.

Removed test_stringify_invalid test case since it does not reflect how
the method is actually used in real life.

Change-Id: I0846b2005c00afc1e15bb976ba626293d79a27e7
Partial-Bug: #1541928
"}]
commit_message:
objects: avoid validation in stringify for custom field types

stringify() is used only in base __repr__ method for objects, where the
value passed into the method is getattr(self, field_name). Since
validation was already executed when the attribute was set on the object
(in 'coerce'), there is no need to repeat the validation in stringify.

Removed test_stringify_invalid test case since it does not reflect how
the method is actually used in real life.

Change-Id: I0846b2005c00afc1e15bb976ba626293d79a27e7
Partial-Bug: #1541928
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/04/302704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_stringify_invalid(self): for in_val in self.coerce_bad_values: self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.field.stringify, in_val)

I could not find any use of this exception in Neutron,
nor in any other project. It has a bad message: the policy

commit_message:
Remove unused PolicyFileNotFound exception

I could not find any use of this exception in Neutron,
nor in any other project. It has a bad message: the policy
file name is hard coded. The policy file name is a config
option so it could be anything.

It should have been deleted with https://review.openstack.org/123673

Discovered while picking exceptions to move to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I4732d84186520be3286417579ee3e2528fcf53a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/302497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: "rescue_unrescue", "pause_unpause", "suspend_resume", "lock_unlock", "shelve_unshelve"] action_builder.bind_action("pause_unpause", self._pause_and_unpause_server) action_builder.bind_action("suspend_resume", self._suspend_and_resume_server) action_builder.bind_action("lock_unlock", self._lock_and_unlock_server) action_builder.bind_action("shelve_unshelve", self._shelve_and_unshelve_server) def _pause_and_unpause_server(self, server): """Pause and then unpause the given server. A pause will be issued on the given server upon which time this method will wait for the server to become 'PAUSED'. Once the server is PAUSED an unpause will be issued and this method will wait for the server to become 'ACTIVE' again. :param server: The server to pause and then unpause. """ self._pause_server(server) self._unpause_server(server) def _suspend_and_resume_server(self, server): """Suspend and then resume the given server. A suspend will be issued on the given server upon which time this method will wait for the server to become 'SUSPENDED'. Once the server is SUSPENDED an resume will be issued and this method will wait for the server to become 'ACTIVE' again. :param server: The server to suspend and then resume. """ self._suspend_server(server) self._resume_server(server) def _lock_and_unlock_server(self, server): """Lock and then unlock the given server. A lock will be issued on the given server upon which time this method will wait for the server to become locked'. Once the server is locked an unlock will be issued. :param server: The server to lock and then unlock. """ self._lock_server(server) self._unlock_server(server) def _shelve_and_unshelve_server(self, server): """Shelve and then unshelve the given server. A shelve will be issued on the given server upon which time this method will wait for the server to become 'SHELVED'. Once the server is SHELVED an unshelve will be issued and this method will wait for the server to become 'ACTIVE' again. :param server: The server to shelve and then unshelve. """ self._shelve_server(server) self._unshelve_server(server)

subject: Mitaka updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-26 12:39:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/5afb299d9cdd18b6ebd75fce83ba59f968104f70', 'message': 'Mitaka updates (draft)

This changeset contains updates for Mitaka.

It uses the mitaka-staging repo (set in config/openstack), because
mitaka-proposed and mitaka are still missing some changes.

The scripts should be able to build a cluster and launch a test instance
(manually and using heat).

To build the basedisk (if necessary) and the cluster and launch a test VM:
./tools/repeat-test.sh -b -r 1

Before testing Orchestration, existing VMs may have to be manually
deleted in order to make space for the new VM.

./tools/test-once.sh scripts/test/heat_stack.sh

Change-Id: Idd96525c14abd5903a6631095ccd6797ba91365c

commit_message:
Mitaka updates

This changeset contains updates for Mitaka.

To build the basedisk (if necessary) and the cluster and launch a test VM
once:
./tools/repeat-test.sh -b -r 1

To test Orchestration:

./tools/test-once.sh scripts/test/heat_stack.sh

Change-Id: Idd96525c14abd5903a6631095ccd6797ba91365c

commit_message:
Add skips for KMIP functional tests

In preparation for adding a KMIP gate, adds the ability to skip functional
tests that are not compatible with a KMIP device. Some tests are skipped
because invalid algorithms or bit lengths are passed to the device. Other
tests are skipped because the tested feature doesn't exist for the PyKMIP
software server yet.

To enable skipping the non-compatible functional tests for a KMIP back
end, set the environment variable using:
    export KMIP_PLUGIN_ENABLED=1

Co-authored-by: Nathan Reller <nathan.reller@jhuapl.edu>
Change-Id: Id908bf57233af84bff56d90c75d175b04ccd4373

commit_message:
Handling json-home header for /v1 call

As per related bug, currently seeing CRITICAL failure in barbican logs
which raises unnecessary alarm if someone is monitoring logs for CRITICAL
issues. The error is related to unexpected client input and code is not
able to determine renderer for json-home input case. So just setting
override template when version response is built.

Change-Id: I0f6e5d19969523ddacef6e2bf0c70030af2d049b
Closes-Bug: #1568141

commit_message:
Mutlinode fixup - let Watcher plugin install CLI

The Watcher multinode experimental job is currently not working due
to the fact that the DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT variable is actually
shared by both the primary node and the subnodes. Therefore, I removed
it from the multinode job to let the Watcher plugin deal with this
using 'is_service_enabled' to detect whether we are on the primary
node or not.

Change-Id: I292d109c89c9f07b1440a215d6c50b9243df9abe

commit_message:
clean up sahara-extra release jobs

Set up sahara-extra to use openstack-server-release-jobs instead of just
the tarball jobs so it matches more closely the other projects. Keep the
extra post job for branch-tarball, since that is not part of the server
release jobs macro.

Change-Id: Ibe357ac56e998d54eb42da1076dd370815aa222c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add os_gnocchi role project for OSA

This change adds a new project for the roles within OpenStack-Ansible
for deploying OpenStack Gnocchi by importing the proof-of-concept
code developed independently during the Mitaka cycle.

Implements: role-gnocchi
Needed-By: I0175923b666ca4550709c471dccca1a24df5ad8e
Related-to: I6aeb35b0d502ba78a311b9797b4165a0095d34f1

commit_message:
[i18n] Fix release notes path

Since Zanata client has an option "--srcdir $modulename/locale
--txdir $modulename/locale", we need "../../" prefix.

commit_message:
ha/glance-fs: avoid a race condition

Create the glance-fs Pacemaker resource on one node (pacemaker master)
instead of all nodes, and set verify_on_create to True.

* It will avoid a race condition if Puppet is applied on 2 nodes on the
  same time, so the filesystem is attempted to be created once.
* Verify with psc that the resource has been correctly created.

The full context of the bug is decribed here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1319384

Change-Id: I625f0879ae56e814664d1433ae47e27148779f12

commit_message:
Remove network/noop.yaml, use OS::Heat::None

Removes the old noop nested stack template for networks and
instead uses OS::Heat::None instead. This should avoid a few
extra resource checks on create and update.

Change-Id: Ia3d7f62dbda2705ffc3d9edcddebcd3ece3cc9d2

commit_message:
Fix indexing of dict.keys() in python3

It will throw TypeError when you try to operate on
dict.keys() like a list in python3.
ref:https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dictionary-view-objects

Change-Id: Ic8f5f02b24f5af5de0696a5f9cf0033c42cac4f4

commit_message:
Fix python2,3 compatibility issues

1. Stop using string.split() since it does not exist in python3.
2. map() returns a list in python2 but iterator object in python3.
ref:
http://www.diveintopython3.net/porting-code-to-python-3-with-2to3.html

Change-Id: I3f38bfed7b0a8959bf4c8c9625ddc65dbb11164a

commit_message:
Fix image list in glance_image provider

https://review.openstack.org/298718 changed the way images are listed,
by removing the '--long' parameter. This breaks when called by the
openstacklib provider, because that was the "properties" argument in
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/adb0b1d0122a5aeb66553b1e7340439dea7d0b13/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L74
so the command-line used '' as a last argument, causing the failure.

This will require a stable/mitaka backport.

Change-Id: I69e3cc848fbacbda01f9bd7d8a079c99b15cb5cf
(cherry picked from commit 109cda8b248cdd0de08d9b1d584f4433bf8cf1ce)

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Ie98c1aec65281fa1784070ce76e472caca7cfc47
Closes-bug: #1268480
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/30/262530/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIsInstance(creds.identity_admin_client, json_iden_client.IdentityClient) self.assertIsInstance(creds.network_admin_client, json_network_client.NetworkClient)

commit_message:
Remove init scripts used to set MTU on xenial+

When deploying on xenial or higher, no longer render the upstart scripts for
setting NIC MTU.

The scripts are being removed rather than converted to systemd on xenial
because MAAS1.9 now has the functionality needed to set the mtu on all ports,
even if they do not have ip address configuration. MAAS1.9 will also ensure
that they are upped during boot

Also needed a driveby fix of missing charms to satisfy relations in amulet
tests

Change-Id: Ib420b7c0135b61c115e69a09859353e7cd693539
Partial-Bug: 1566786
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway refs/changes/90/302190/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: drop_config = [] # Use MAAS1.9 for MTU and external port config on xenial and above if lsb_release()['DISTRIB_CODENAME'] >= 'xenial': drop_config.extend([EXT_PORT_CONF, PHY_NIC_MTU_CONF]) for _config in drop_config: if _config in config_files[plugin]: config_files[plugin].pop(_config)
deleted_lines: for _config in drop_config: if _config in config_files[plugin]: config_files[plugin].pop(_config)

commit_message:
Add Subnet add/remove support to router

The following patch adds the support for
"router add subnet" and "router remove subnet"
to the OSC as a part of migration of Neutron's
CLI commands.

Partial-Bug: #1546849
Implements: blueprint neutron-client-advanced-router
Change-Id: Ia3770c41026194bdb1543d4e67446f81936d44d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/16/289716/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: router_add_subnet = openstackclient.network.v2.router_interface:AddSubnetToRouter

commit_message:
ovo: Update object with data from db on update()

The former behavior caused that on calling update() load_from_db()
object was populated with data from object itself instead of data
returned from database.

Partial-Bug: 1541928
Change-Id: If91934ffca43732457b7d3e414124d998e77cfd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/302267/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.from_db_object(db_obj)

commit_message:
Improve the help text for the linuxnet options (1)

The previous commit moved all the options from network/linuxnet.py to a
central location in nova/conf/network.py. This commit adds additional
help text to those options.  Because of the large number of options, the
improved help text will be split into several patches; this is patch 1
of 4.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I79b587aa6bba902f53c786646f47f610ca9bc2fd

added_lines: default=['/etc/nova/nova-dhcpbridge.conf'], help=""" This option is a list of full paths to one or more configuration files for dhcpbridge. In most cases the default path of '/etc/nova/nova-dhcpbridge.conf' should be sufficient, but if you have special needs for configuring dhcpbridge, you can change or add to this list. * Possible values A list of strings, where each string is the full path to a dhcpbridge configuration file. * Services that use this: ``nova-network`` * Related options: None """), default=paths.state_path_def('networks'), help=""" The location where the network configuration files will be kept. The default is the 'networks' directory off of the location where nova's Python module is installed. * Possible values A string containing the full path to the desired configuration directory * Services that use this: ``nova-network`` * Related options: None """), default='eth0', help=""" This is the name of the network interface for public IP addresses. The default is 'eth0'. * Possible values: Any string representing a network interface name * Services that use this: ``nova-network`` * Related options: None """), default=paths.bindir_def('nova-dhcpbridge'), help=""" The location of the binary nova-dhcpbridge. By default it is the binary named 'nova-dhcpbridge' that is installed with all the other nova binaries. * Possible values: Any string representing the full path to the binary for dhcpbridge * Services that use this: ``nova-network`` * Related options: None """), default='$my_ip', help=""" This is the public IP address of the network host. It is used when creating a SNAT rule. * Possible values: Any valid IP address * Services that use this: ``nova-network`` * Related options: force_snat_range """), default=86400, help=""" The lifetime of a DHCP lease, in seconds. The default is 86400 (one day). Possible values: Any positive integer value. * Services that use this: ``nova-network`` * Related options: None """),

commit_message:
Add "router remove port" to osc

This patch proposes the migration of port
deletion of Neutron's "router-interface-delete"
to OSC's "router remove port".

Change-Id: Ifceabce080aacac9f6410c809fcc097760e0c5ee
Partial-Bug: #1546849
Implements: blueprint neutron-client-advanced-router
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/94/281694/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Router-Interface implementations""" from openstackclient.common import command from openstackclient.identity import common as identity_common class AddRouterPort(command.ShowOne): """Add a new port interface to the router""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(AddRouterPort, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'port', metavar='<PORT>', help="ID or name of the port to add.", ) parser.add_argument( 'router', metavar='<ROUTER>', help="ID or name of the router.", ) identity_common.add_project_domain_option_to_parser(parser) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network obj = client.find_router(parsed_args.router, ignore_missing=False) body = {} if parsed_args.port and client.find_port(parsed_args.port, ignore_missing=False): body['port_id'] = str(parsed_args.port) client.add_interface_router(obj, **body) return class DeleteRouterPort(command.Command): """Delete router(s)""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(DeleteRouterPort, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'port', metavar='<PORT>', help="ID or name of the port to delete.", ) parser.add_argument( 'router', metavar='<ROUTER>', help="ID or name of the router.", ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network obj = client.find_router(parsed_args.router, ignore_missing=False) body = {} if parsed_args.port and client.find_port(parsed_args.port, ignore_missing=False): body['port_id'] = str(parsed_args.port) client.remove_interface_router(obj, **body) return

commit_message:
Merge tag '8.0.0'

This is a null-merge of the 8.0.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 8.0.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I8661c7614e3e737bca13218ccec32f2101b68a7f

commit_message:
Add attribute for extra specs to Nova::Flavor

Currently there's no possibility to check extra specs
of flavor resource, so add new attribute for it.

Change-Id: I189cb1c3de6bac367ce8067a3ef7990b94d92287
Closes-bug: #1566830

commit_message:
Fix the qemu has nova permission in nova instances folder

Fix the permission issue on different distro
* In CentOS, add the qemu to nova group in CentOS
* In Ubuntu, add the nova to libvirtd group

Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I1f4f9ce29abf0d788965fe94d8918b10a7169a75
Closes-Bug: #1568012

commit_message:
Increase max scheduling attempts to 10

At high scale, such as 64 nodes with 13TB ram and 2600 cores, nova
seems to struggle when scheduling 100+ VMs at the same time.  The
issue is unrelated to the database, as the error printed indicates
the max_scheduling_attempts have been reached.  Increase that value
to something more fitting of a 100 node cluster.

Change-Id: I8982d77c7c66db8f7c95b9fd73f58ceb66dbd723
Closes-Bug: #1563664

commit_message:
Increase max pool size so conductor doesn't implode

When horizon is used to launch 2000 VMs, nova-conductor is very
busy making database connections.  All 55 database connections are
in use, resulting in an inability to garbage collect database
connections.  Instead raise the max pool to 50 which will allow
50 concurrent database connections and the max overflow to 1000
which permits the database connections to finish the job at
large nodecount scales.

Closes-Bug: #1565105

Change-Id: I26dc2f7fda8760197888a1d61fbc45dfada2dd06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/15/302415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max_pool_size = 50 max_overflow = 1000

commit_message:
Add "__repr__" method to class "Service"

The class "Service" doesn't have a "__repr__" method which results
in log outputs like:

    DEBUG [...] service = <nova.service.Service object at 0x56eb890>

This is not helpful when analyzing logs. Therefore this change adds a
"__repr__" method.

Change-Id: I49c8b7f0dde298de780808c988e4b50278eed665
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/303417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_repr(self): # Test if a Service object is correctly represented, for example in # log files. serv = service.Service(self.host, self.binary, self.topic, 'nova.tests.unit.test_service.FakeManager') exp = "<Service: host=foo, binary=nova-fake, " \ "manager_class_name=nova.tests.unit.test_service.FakeManager>" self.assertEqual(exp, repr(serv))

subject: Refactor CORS unit tests

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-22 05:31:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/04d3f91e25155fa219d451b7921a245841ba7611', 'message': "Add CORS unit tests more

This is a follow-up patch for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258392/
That one added good unit test cases for various kinds of

commit_message:
Refactor CORS unit tests

This is a follow-up patch for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258392/
That one added good unit test cases for various kinds of
allowe_origin like '*' or ''(empty). However, the result of handling
in Swift proxy will depend on strict_cors_mode option configuration.

This patch refactors the unit tests to split out for
strict_cors_mode = on/off and add some missing unit tests for
each case.

Change-Id: I55f7cd279436b5c9f71d81fecf06021380e35579

test expose_headers to non-allowed origins container_cors = {'allow_origin': 'http://not.foo.bar', 'expose_headers': 'X-Object-Meta-Color ' 'X-Object-Meta-Color-Ex'} resp = self._get_CORS_response( container_cors=container_cors, strict_mode=False) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status_int) self.assertEqual('http://foo.bar', resp.headers['access-control-allow-origin']) self.assertEqual('red', resp.headers['x-object-meta-color']) # X-Super-Secret is in the response, but not "exposed" self.assertEqual('hush', resp.headers['x-super-secret']) self.assertIn('access-control-expose-headers', resp.headers) exposed = set( h.strip() for h in resp.headers['access-control-expose-headers'].split(',')) expected_exposed = set(['cache-control', 'content-language', 'content-type', 'expires', 'last-modified', 'pragma', 'etag', 'x-timestamp', 'x-trans-id', 'x-object-meta-color', 'x-object-meta-color-ex']) self.assertEqual(expected_exposed, exposed) # commit_message:
Assert that ChunkWriteTimouts are not raised

Follow up for change Ibbc89449e7878fc4215e47e3f7dfe4ae58a2d638
to add a test assertion that the ChunkWriteTimeout contexts are
exited without raising the timeout exception in
iter_bytes_from_response_part().

Change-Id: I6d323cb26779e457fb5940093a81b349b333a0af

commit_message:
Close XenAPI sessions in neutron-rootwrap-xen-dom0

Neutron with XenServer properly doesn't close XenAPI sessions.
If it creates these sessions so rapidly, the XenServer host eventually
exceeds its maximum allowed number of connections.
This patch adds a close process for session.

Closes-Bug: 1558721
Change-Id: Ida90a970c649745c492c28c41c4a151e4d940aa6
(cherry picked from commit 9d21b5ad7edbf9ac1fd9254e97f56966f25de8e6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/296512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add strip() to filter string in instances

admin/instances and project/instaces
have server filter field.
This field do not strip search string,
so attempt to search "test " will return
nothing. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I6a56a95e8b9b46384c0ee9da4968abcbb0ecff70
Closes-Bug: #1564878
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/46/300446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add IPAllocation object to session info to stop GC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 21:09:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/83f4f2239a5c9c9d212bc6a8d191b584cabe9b45', 'message': "Add IPAllocation object to session info to stop GC

This adds the IPAllocation object created in the _store_ip_allocation
method to the session info dictionary to prevent it from being
immediately garbage collected. This is necessary because otherwise a
new persistent object will be created when the fixed_ips relationship
is referenced during the rest of the port create/update opertions.
This persistent object will then interfere with a retry operation
that uses the same session if it tries to create a conflicting record.

By preventing the object from being garbage collected, the reference
to fixed IPs will re-use the newly created sqlalchemy object instead
which will properly be cleaned up on a rollback.

This also removes the 'passive_delete' option from the fixed_ips
relationship on ports because IPAllocation objects would now be
left in the session after port deletes. At first glance, this might
look like a performance penalty because fixed_ips would be looked
up before port deletes; however, we already do that in the IPAM
code as well as the ML2 code so this relationship is already being
loaded on the delete_port operation.

Closes-Bug: #1556178
Change-Id: Ieee1343bb90cf111c55e00b9cabc27943b46c350

commit_message:
Add IPAllocation object to session info to stop GC

This adds the IPAllocation object created in the _store_ip_allocation
method to the session info dictionary to prevent it from being
immediately garbage collected. This is necessary because otherwise a
new persistent object will be created when the fixed_ips relationship
is referenced during the rest of the port create/update opertions.
This persistent object will then interfere with a retry operation
that uses the same session if it tries to create a conflicting record.

By preventing the object from being garbage collected, the reference
to fixed IPs will re-use the newly created sqlalchemy object instead
which will properly be cleaned up on a rollback.

This also removes the 'passive_delete' option from the fixed_ips
relationship on ports because IPAllocation objects would now be
left in the session after port deletes. At first glance, this might
look like a performance penalty because fixed_ips would be looked
up before port deletes; however, we already do that in the IPAM
code as well as the ML2 code so this relationship is already being
loaded on the delete_port operation.

Closes-Bug: #1556178
Change-Id: Ieee1343bb90cf111c55e00b9cabc27943b46c350
(cherry picked from commit 7d9169967fca3d81076cf60eb772f4506735a218)

commit_message:
No unit test coverage for code related to Flavors

When runing the "./run_tests.sh -c" command,
and after looking at the reports, not all the code is covered
by the unit tests.
The code related to Flavors in the openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py
(get flavor list, create flavor, delete flavor, etc) is not covered.

Change-Id: Idf32b22cde2925b830d85ba9c675fa0e88a2eb0e
Closes-Bug:#1558758

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-02 01:11:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/4c8a94e73553525294b53e7a9d51770c61430c4a', 'message': 'Fix zuul_cloner errors during tox job setup

Since [1], Tempest is a pip installable package, and that prevents zuul_cloner
to work correctly. This change moves away from the existing logic in tox_install,
and adds tempest as an explicit requirement for the api job. This is in fact
the only tox target that needs Tempest to work.

tox_install.sh has become less important now, but cleanup is left as follow
up, to speed up gate salvation.

Fix multiple job failures

zuul_cloner errors during tox job setup, and pep8 complains too.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 15:50:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/a9f9d1867e710d71e54c636ad016a81ef46f89f6', 'message': "ODL v2: Fix multiple updates race - Second patch

In case there are multiple updates in the journal there is a chance that
the updates will be sent to ODL controller in the wrong order.

This second patch introduce different approach for fixing the bug.

in the right order by checking if there are older updates in the queue.

commit_message:
ODL v2: Fix multiple updates race

In case there are multiple updates in the journal there is a chance that
the updates will be sent to ODL controller in the wrong order.

The logic in this patch is to handle the updates in the right order
by checking if there are older updates in the queue.
Once an older update has been found the row will go back to the queue
by setting the state back to 'pending'.

Change-Id: I20fd701355327118886cf7e7e9385133c58213af
Closes-Bug: #1561516

added_lines: from datetime import timedelta def _decrease_row_created_time(self, row): row.created_at -= timedelta(hours=1) self.db_session.merge(row) self.db_session.flush() def test_sync_multiple_updates(self): # add 2 updates for i in range(2): self._call_operation_object(odl_const.ODL_UPDATE, odl_const.ODL_NETWORK) # get the last update row last_row = db.get_all_db_rows(self.db_session)[-1] # change the last update created time self._decrease_row_created_time(last_row) # create 1 more operation to trigger the sync thread # verify that there are no calls to ODL controller, because the # first row was not valid (exit_after_run = true) self._test_thread_processing(odl_const.ODL_UPDATE, odl_const.ODL_NETWORK, expected_calls=0) # validate that all the rows are in 'pending' state # first row should be set back to 'pending' because it was not valid rows = db.get_all_db_rows_by_state(self.db_session, 'pending') self.assertEqual(3, len(rows))

commit_message:
Reduce dependency validations code duplication

Refactored the following code:
1)Move the update operation validation to new method to
reuse an existing logic.
2)Changed the signature of the validation methods to get the row
object and not field by field, so it will be more flexible.

Change-Id: I3fefa30d20b40a24fe983e24b94ceefe6a6fe81b

commit_message:
Create a test flavor for the pingtest VM

The m1.demo flavor is created arbitrarily by the client but we
want to remove the post-deployment initialization so we switch
the pingtest VM flavor to one we create from the template itself.

Change-Id: Iec0a64b24813536dd591362f1aefe46135a5a16e

See:
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/exception.py#L122-L126

Thanks to ChangBo Guo(gcb) who find this:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285712/

Change-Id: I99c891b865ec507875d2a48e3e7d1f4a3b1bb9cb
Closes-bug: 1561413
"}]
commit_message:
Fix meaningless quota exceeded exception info

When updating a nested quota with exceeded value, a meaningless
info is returned to user.

In Cinder, exception's attribute 'message' is a format string,
not including details. We need to use 'msg' instead of it.

See:
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/exception.py#L122-L126

Thanks to ChangBo Guo(gcb) who find this:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285712/

Change-Id: I99c891b865ec507875d2a48e3e7d1f4a3b1bb9cb
Closes-bug: 1561413

added_lines: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=e.msg)

commit_message:
EMC VMAX - Operations and timeout issues

If a volume operation e.g create, delete, expand, etc were to
timeout without fully completing then we were not appropriately
catching the error with the appropriate rc (return code) or
errordesc (Error description). This new method does an additional
check to appropriately capture the status of the job i.e. did it
fail to complete in the allocated time.

Change-Id: I0b74f9941d722083b70c12bbebeb269d315c02b3
Closes-Bug: #1538214

commit_message:
Watch for 'new' events in ovsdb monitor for ofport

This adjusts the event handling logic in the ovs interface
monitor to watch for 'new' events as well because this is
when ofports are assigned to the interface. Previously we
were only watching for 'insert' events, which would never
include the ofport so this led to every port being skipped
initially by the OVS agent and then picked up on the next
polling interval.

Closes-Bug: #1560464
Change-Id: I46ac508a839c6db779323d5afb083f3425f96e87
(cherry picked from commit 62e88623d977d28c113a1e29458621f82d48f6e5)

subject: Removes host file contents from DHCP agent logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 09:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bd3e9c3b1e759d4296cdb9a816a63ef773ea5f63', 'message': "Removes host file contents from DHCP agent logs

The change I3ad7864eeb2f959549ed356a1e34fa18804395cc addressed a
performance impact by removing logging calls from inside the loop that
creates the hosts file in memory. However, it also introduced the
dumping of said hosts file to the logs.

On deployments with a very high number of ports(>5K), this increases the
load of the node substantially. The problem is worse when a high number
of port updates is received in a short amount of time.

There is also the administrative burden caused by the sheer amount of
data being logged.

If the content of the host file is required for debugging purposes, it
can be found at /opt/stack/data/neutron/dhcp/<net-id>/host

This patch is trivial and only removes the logging of the file contents.
The 'building'/'done building' logging calls may still provide useful
information.

Change-Id: Ie176ef123c194c22dca0967a6acfb9a48c959e6c
Closes-Bug: 1557640
(cherry picked from commit ed7411fa1c4d6a26cea3a8737b3c29ce6ff64363)
"}]
commit_message:
Removes host file contents from DHCP agent logs

The change I3ad7864eeb2f959549ed356a1e34fa18804395cc addressed a
performance impact by removing logging calls from inside the loop that
creates the hosts file in memory. However, it also introduced the
dumping of said hosts file to the logs.

On deployments with a very high number of ports(>5K), this increases the
load of the node substantially. The problem is worse when a high number
of port updates is received in a short amount of time.

There is also the administrative burden caused by the sheer amount of
data being logged.

If the content of the host file is required for debugging purposes, it
can be found at /opt/stack/data/neutron/dhcp/<net-id>/host

This patch is trivial and only removes the logging of the file contents.
The 'building'/'done building' logging calls may still provide useful
information.

Change-Id: Ie176ef123c194c22dca0967a6acfb9a48c959e6c
Closes-Bug: 1557640
(cherry picked from commit ed7411fa1c4d6a26cea3a8737b3c29ce6ff64363)

commit_message:
port security: gracefully handle resources with no bindings

Resources could be created before the extension was enabled in the
setup. In that case, no bindings are created for them. In that case, we
should gracefully return default (True) value when extracting the value
using the mixin; and we should also create binding model on update
request, if there is no existing binding model for the resource.

While at it, introduced a constant to store the default value for port
security (True) and changed several tests to use the constant instead of
extracting it from extension resource map.

Change-Id: I8607cdecdc16c5f94635c94e2f02700c732806eb
Closes-Bug: #1509312
(cherry picked from commit b0519cf0ada3b3d9b76f84948f9ad3c142fc50be)

commit_message:
NG launch instance: Clear fileInput value on text change

The onchange event occurs when a control loses the input
focus and its value has been modified since gaining focus.
This attribute applies to the following elements:
INPUT, SELECT, and TEXTAREA.
http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/interact/scripts.html#adef-onchange

This affected uploading a script and modifying it, as it would
not allow to reupload it again.
This patch cleans the fileInput.val() on textInput change so
a user can upload a script, modify it, and reupload the same
script again if he wants to start from a clean scratch again

Change-Id: Ie2d29de4ebcdea07f7e3e2ce6c7094c1d2fe5e10
Closes-Bug: #1522067
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/77/258477/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* onchange event occurs when a control loses the input focus and * its value has been modified since gaining focus so we need to clear * up the fileInput.val() when the textContent field is modified as to * allow reloading the same script */ var textContentWatcher = $scope.$watch(function () { return $scope.textContent; }, function () { if (fileInput.val() !== "") { fileInput.val(null); } }, true); $scope.$on('$destroy', function() { textContentWatcher(); });

commit_message:
acceptance: drop dependency cycles tests

They bring no value in our CI, we already test a full deployment of
Glance and workflow of image upload, we don't need them.
Moreover, they make our life complicated when debbuging CI issues.

Let's drop the tests.

Change-Id: I94fa88d661dc83d4f1803ab3275ff0cfa58b6c5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/93/303593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: it 'should configure the glance endpoint before the glance-api service uses it' do pp2 = pp + "Service['glance-api'] -> Keystone_endpoint['RegionOne/Image Service::image']" expect(apply_manifest(pp2, :expect_failures => true, :noop => true).stderr).to match(/Found 1 dependency cycle/i) end it 'should configure the glance user before the glance-api service uses it' do pp2 = pp + "Service['glance-api'] -> Keystone_user_role['glance@services']" expect(apply_manifest(pp2, :expect_failures => true, :noop => true).stderr).to match(/Found 1 dependency cycle/i) end it 'should configure the glance user before the glance-registry service uses it' do pp2 = pp + "Service['glance-registry'] -> Keystone_user_role['glance@services']" expect(apply_manifest(pp2, :expect_failures => true, :noop => true).stderr).to match(/Found 1 dependency cycle/i) end it 'should configure the glance-api service before using it to provision glance_images' do pp2 = pp + "Glance_image['test_image'] -> Service['glance-api']" expect(apply_manifest(pp2, :expect_failures => true, :noop => true).stderr).to match(/Found 1 dependency cycle/i) end

commit_message:
correct tox.ini for coverage

using testr will end up in issue while running tox -e cover and may not
work as desired. this patch will replace it with test as its done in
neutron_vpnaas [1].

[1]. https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/blob/master/tox.ini#L113

Change-Id: If2c10efcda6564daaeba1e8be8cf883a43277662

commit_message:
Add support for Guru Meditation Reports for LBaaS agents

The change consolidates common actions taken by all services under
neutron_lbaas/cmd/... in a way that reflects the approach taken in
neutron repo. This currently includes GMR initialization and eventlet
monkey patching.

Added oslo.reports dependency since now we explicitly require it.

Change-Id: Ia76b113648536f6786de4029376df2caa25036d1
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Add tempest to requirements

Since tempest-lib is deprecated for future bug-fixes and code changes
in favor of tempest, so tempest will be needed by those projects holding
tempest test in tree. See
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest-lib/readme.html

Change-Id: I25eac915c977ebaedced66ac896c5dd77259d193

commit_message:
Fix image list in glance_image provider

https://review.openstack.org/298718 changed the way images are listed,
by removing the '--long' parameter. This breaks when called by the
openstacklib provider, because that was the "properties" argument in
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/adb0b1d0122a5aeb66553b1e7340439dea7d0b13/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L74
so the command-line used '' as a last argument, causing the failure.

This will require a stable/mitaka backport.

Change-Id: I69e3cc848fbacbda01f9bd7d8a079c99b15cb5cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/33/303533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Edited Solum payloads

The "create" functions weren't being properly fuzzed, since it would
try to recreate the resource with a duplicate name, leading the system
to reject them.

Change-Id: I4360cbe53298bda29fbbe802f72250c28d8664d3

commit_message:
Tempest 11.0.0 is released

Move the requirement to test-requirements so that we can pick up
bot proposals. Let's also match the global-requirement pin.

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/Tempest/11.0.0

commit_message:
Make cinder-all binary deprecated

This command is not tested. Add warning that 'cinder-all' is
deprecated as now cinder services run apart.

Implements: blueprint cinder-all-is-deprecated

commit_message:
[WIP] Strange DSE behavior with publish, publish, read sequence

Trying to understand why test_dse.py:test_policy_data_pub_read_pub_read passes
but test_policy_data_pub_pub_read fails.

Basically, this test works perfectly:
        ins_p2 = compile.Event(policy.parse1('p(2)'))
        ins_p3 = compile.Event(policy.parse1('p(3)'))
        data.publish('p', [ins_p2])
        helper.retry_check_db_equal(policy, 'data:p(x)', 'data:p(2)’) #star#
        data.publish('p', [ins_p3])
        helper.retry_check_db_equal(policy, 'data:p(x)', 'data:p(2) data:p(3)')

But simply removing the line marked #star# makes the test fail.

Anyone know whether this behavior is normal and expected? Or a bug?

Having added a print statement to print the actual query result output each time retry_check_db_equal retries, the query results starts at empty and goes to 'data:p(3)', but never gets to 'data:p(2) data:p(3)'.

Change-Id: I7c12da7a8e9d2946c8eb37e7f592ef22d5692774

commit_message:
Support l3 dvr patch ports

Support of l3 dvr by creating logical router port on lrouter and
its patch port on connected lswitch when router interface is being
added. ovn_api is also updated according to latest OVN NB schema
for this purpose.

With this support, ports on different subnets are able to talk to
each other by connecting the subnets to the same router.

Closes-Bug: #1514649
Change-Id: I0541b258cc357e2a151b24d865feef181c85056d

commit_message:
devstack: Enable skydive-agent in local.conf.sample.

local.conf.sample is setup to be both a controller and compute host.  We
should run both skydive-analyzer and skydive-agent.

Change-Id: I8bf1093fd494f784baa487f4982339b832a5b732
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make gate-neutron-dsvm-api job non-voting

This is done as a temporary measure until we can drastically limit
the string on failures that have been hitting since change a2fe5f.

Initially a similar attempt was done with [1], but that strategy
was not deemed worthy. Whilst we work out how to complete the
decoupling effort, it is safer to allow the wider team to work
without too much disruption.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274182/

Change-Id: I3ee94e31e091f6ac35b2503f960720cbe49ac548
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/00/303100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix race conditions in IP availability API tests

DHCP port creation is asynchronous with subnet creation.
Therefore there is a time window where, depending on how fast
the DHCP agent honors the request, the DHCP port IP allocation
may or may not be accounted for in the total number of used IP
for the network. To kill the race, do not run dhcp on the
created subnets at all.

Closes-bug: 1563883

Change-Id: Idda25e65d04852d68a3c160cc9deefdb4ee82dcd

subject: Update shell.py to support object environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-09 00:08:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient/commit/a514709497ffb6c04968da546ada769d169bae4c', 'message': "Add --environment-object option to heatclient

Add a new --environment-object option to Heatclient which can be
used alongside of the existing --environment-file option. Use
of the new --environment-object is optional. If used it
can be specified multiple times to load multiple environments
from a Swift container URL.

Any relative URL's within the Heat environment file are

commit_message:
Update shell.py to support object environments

This patch updates shell.py so that it supports using
the new env_path_is_object and object_request for
template_utils.process_multiple_environments_and_files.

To do this we implement a new custom env_path_is_object
function in shell.py so that any time a template_object
is passed in we automatically detect if an associated
environment URL matches the base URL and is also an
object.

This should allow users of --template-object to
transparent begin making use of --environment-file (URL's too!)
that also reside in a Swift object container.

Change-Id: I068c9015f74a066c35d0742a93b0cc21c899e916

commit_message:
pacemaker: Set manage_service/enabled via Hiera

Updates the pacemaker manifest so that we set most of
the manage_service and enabled parameters via Hiera.
This allows us to make most of the OpenStack services
simple includes instead of more verbose class statements.

Change-Id: I9efbb7ccedd9fd28c02ee373f4177ff9c64925ef

commit_message:
Fix maintain old oslo loggers names

Closes-Bug: #1567902

We should not change names of loggers.
It is't help if somebody to want to use direct import
of python logging module like it does in oslo_messaging.

Instead of this, just fix the naming style
when a logging level is set for oslo modules
in the '_setup_logging_from_conf' method.

Change-Id: Ie3ef54f5472394e245a4961317fc7b02bc163dbc

subject: Pause/resume for ceph-osd charm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 11:30:46.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/utils.py', 'hooks/ceph.py', 'hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'actions/pause_resume.py', 'actions/resume', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'actions/pause', 'unit_tests/test_actions_pause_resume.py', 'actions.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/bbfdeb84f0d130489a9a4ec979a46afbd80bb292', 'message': "Pause/resume for ceph-osd charm

This changeset provides pause and resume actions to the ceph charm.
The pause action issues a 'ceph osd out <local_id>' for each of the
ceph osd ids that are on the unit.  The action does not stop the
ceph osd processes.

Note that if the pause-health action is NOT used on the ceph-mon
charm then the cluster will start trying to rebalance the PGs accross
the remaining OSDs.  If the cluster might reach its 'full ratio' then
this will be a breaking action.  The charm does NOT check for this
eventuality.

The resume action issues a 'ceph osd in <local_id>' for each of the
local ceph osd process on the unit.

The charm 'remembers' that a pause action was issued, and if
successful, it shows a 'maintenance' workload status as a reminder.

Change-Id: I9f53c9c6c4bb737670ffcd542acec0b320cc7f6a
"}]
commit_message:
Pause/resume for ceph-osd charm

This changeset provides pause and resume actions to the ceph charm.
The pause action issues a 'ceph osd out <local_id>' for each of the
ceph osd ids that are on the unit.  The action does not stop the
ceph osd processes.

Note that if the pause-health action is NOT used on the ceph-mon
charm then the cluster will start trying to rebalance the PGs accross
the remaining OSDs.  If the cluster might reach its 'full ratio' then
this will be a breaking action.  The charm does NOT check for this
eventuality.

The resume action issues a 'ceph osd in <local_id>' for each of the
local ceph osd process on the unit.

The charm 'remembers' that a pause action was issued, and if
successful, it shows a 'maintenance' workload status as a reminder.

Change-Id: I9f53c9c6c4bb737670ffcd542acec0b320cc7f6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/60/303360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pause: description: | CAUTION - Set the local osd units in the charm to 'out' but does not stop the osds. Unless the osd cluster is set to noout (see below), this removes them from the ceph cluster and forces ceph to migrate the PGs to other OSDs in the cluster. See the following. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/operations/add-or-rm-osds/#removing-the-osd "Do not let your cluster reach its full ratio when removing an OSD. Removing OSDs could cause the cluster to reach or exceed its full ratio." Also note that for small clusters you may encounter the corner case where some PGs remain stuck in the active+remapped state. Refer to the above link on how to resolve this. pause-health (on a ceph-mon) unit can be used before pausing a ceph-osd unit to stop the cluster rebalancing the data off this ceph-osd unit. pause-health sets 'noout' on the cluster such that it will not try to rebalance the data accross the remaining units. It is up to the user of the charm to determine whether pause-health should be used as it depends on whether the osd is being paused for maintenance or to remove it from the cluster completely. resume: description: | Set the local osd units in the charm to 'in'. Note that the pause option does NOT stop the osd processes.

commit_message:
Devstack plugin update

- Installing docker and nova-docker driver in plugin.sh
- Handling virt driver option in /etc/nova/nova.conf
  differently for local dev env and the gate

For local dev environment (vagrant, vagrant+devstack),
we want the the virt driver option to be set to 'docker'.
So doing that in plugin.sh. On the other hand, our devstack
gate is not configured to use nova-docker. It is configured
to use 'vm'. Therefore, unsetting the virt driver option
in the post_test_hook.sh

Change-Id: I5349ecee1dec3a56a8836ee97a238b3776748e6b

commit_message:
always use pip constraints

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for all
targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process. This
makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our
new world order.

Change-Id: I857032002c2ca873510ce7c39138e0e35cc5d3b3

commit_message:
Move multi-tenant server negative tests into subclass

Most of the server negative tests only require one tenant/project,
but the base class requires two tenants. This patch creates a
new subclass to isolate the multi-tenant tests, allowing for
fewer resources to be allocated for tests that do not need to
check tenant isolation. This work is in part to support DefCore
efforts [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/253138/

Change-Id: I2319558165a2a098e7af4f6965ed1e00e69c46df

commit_message:
Restart apache2 safely when using mod_wsgi

The restart_on_change function uses the underlying init systems service
control programs to stop/start/restart services. However, sometimes
these misbehave like apache2 with mod_wsgi which can leave process
running after stop has completed which then block start from running.
These change ensures that apache really has stopped before starting it.

Change-Id: I8255d8f5371f7bb0783878253afafcf27275b6b8
Closes-Bug: 1567741

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded pip indexes from repo-build playbook

With the repo build process pip indexes being optional, and the AIO
process making use of the OpenStack-CI provided pip.conf file, the
indexes no longer need to be set in the playbook.

This patch removes them, allowing the pip indexes to be entirely
controlled by the user.

Change-Id: I22c6fc38164b47b9ffa10de6de73a57c3e071c60
Depends-On: I25e4faecbffad6301509c62f55c34ba86b92a658
(cherry picked from commit 797dbb6de678811f48df311cff834f7eb9184a56)

to inacurately claim that the content is different.  Since
we don't care what order the json data is stored, this
comparison is now done on a sorted data set.

Closes-Bug: #1437179

commit_message:
Fix get_flavors test by sorting json output

The get_flavors unit test sometimes fails as the list can
come back in a different order.  This causes the json comparison
to inacurately claim that the content is different.  Since
we don't care what order the json data is stored, this
comparison is now done on a sorted data set.

Closes-Bug: #1437179
Change-Id: I92eaa1c98f5a58ce124210f2b6a2136dfc573a29
(cherry picked from commit 7a9e02a1fa50fdccf0d06e9706a4bec25f127c5c)

deleted_lines: expected = json.loads(original) actual = json.loads(output) if expected != actual:

commit_message:
Pull the network settings from the actual dict

Turns out self._openstack_config is not the config dict. self.config is.
Also, return names.

commit_message:
remove alembic from requirements.txt

Alembic was used in attempt #1 of online schema migrations, however
that was reverted in Icae28ceee3ec975c907d73b95babab58dcb30c23 when
that approach was dropped.

There are no other uses of alembic directly in Nova, so we should not
list this requirement.

Change-Id: I452bfc8454aedff1bbaffacc99d0845186ba4234

commit_message:
Install: Simplify OpenRC files

Simplify OpenRC files by removing the '.sh' suffix and
using '.' instead of 'source' to load them.

Change-Id: Ic553ea10ac4f3958525c97bbda02ebe7d4bac24f
Implements: bp installguide-mitaka

commit_message:
Add project scoped token when obtaning token

Currently, when using script federated_login.sh, it will throw
error about using a project scoped token. This patch aim to provide
missing project scoped token when using in k2k system.

Change-Id: I79ead3a6c553754fbd2e37e7c1a2f6958e6bff14
Closes-Bug: #1561875

commit_message:
Adapt to fixtures 2.0 constraints

The release of fixtures 2.0 added some constraints on monkeypatched
methods needing to very closely match the patched in method. As a result
some fake methods need to be "massaged" in order to match the binding
profile of the method they're intending to patch.

Hopefully this will be addressed in fixtures 2.1 and these can be
removed.

Change-Id: I9ff4f9569512f57f49de7027860a978e8f368acf

commit_message:
Revert "Turn rax-ord on slowly, max to 10"

We've collected a sufficient sample of new failures with our desired
debugging data included, so shutting rax-ord back off again for now
while we continue to assist the provider troubleshoot.

This reverts commit 8edd84d148c1cf0ad6222814c14087f933ac1e80.

Change-Id: I845e1bda9274f7f9c20faca4a148a65dbf80cf3d

commit_message:
Fix for deleting audit template

We need to update sqlalchemy/api and sqlalchemy/models (and appropriate tests)
to support deleting audit templates and recreating them with the same names.

Change-Id: Icf54cf1ed989a3f2ad689e25be4474b16a3a3eb2
Related-Bug: #1510179

commit_message:
Update .coveragerc to ignore abstract methods

Due to importing modules rather than functions and decorators directly,
@abc.abstract and 'raise NotImplementedError' were added to the
.coveragerc file.  Since abstract methods are not testable, this will
give us a more accurate representation of our coverage.

Change-Id: Id5ed5e1f5e142d10f41ad18d20228399226ec20d
Co-Authored-By: Jin Li <jl7351@att.com>
Closes-Bug: #1563717
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/65/299565/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @abc.abstract raise NotImplementedError

commit_message:
Include security role in setup-hosts.yml

The openstack-ansible-security role is now included in the
setup-hosts.yml playbook but it still requires a deployer to
set apply_security_hardening to True for it to be applied.

Change-Id: I02324b15a4ddffa52b15a23bd381892d4dfd39fc
(cherry picked from commit 00207d3988853c3e1eb32297154276199d740522)

commit_message:
Add fixtures into test-requirements

We have broken gate, because we have no limitation to fixtures,
and the new version is incompatible to us.
We need to add fixtures into test-requirements to make
sure that we always up to date with global requirements.
Closes-Bug: #1567731

Change-Id: Ib0cac0c217db195ce3723cee3f09d26e6be9f0ea

Remove nova mentions from tasks and tags

A task made mention of nova and was tagged with tags applicable
to nova. This removes them.

commit_message:
Restrict deletion of "default" security group

This patch restricts deletion of "default" security group in
a tenant using admin client only and not non-admin user client.

Change-Id: I0eaa57cc00c5bccc2657d094357ea0bb65524984
Closes-Bug: #1557662

added_lines: def list(self): resources = self._resource + "s" list_method = getattr(self._manager(), "list_%s" % resources) tenant_sgs = filter(lambda r: r["tenant_id"] == self.tenant_uuid, list_method(tenant_id=self.tenant_uuid)[resources]) # NOTE(pirsriva): Filter out "default" security group deletion # by non-admin role user if not (self.admin and self.admin_required): return filter(lambda r: r["name"] != "default", tenant_sgs) return tenant_sgs

commit_message:
Add "router add port" to osc

This patch proposes the migration of port addition of
Neutron's "router-interface-add" to OSC's "router add port".

Change-Id: I3a8a76d384caa32975f8e77f50f3cf3c3be13786
Closes-Bug: #1546849
Depends-On: I9783bc4ccceae3d361dce52d51483ef2187920a9
Implements: blueprint neutron-client-advanced-router
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/91/281691/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Router-Interface implementations""" from openstackclient.common import command from openstackclient.identity import common as identity_common class AddRouterPort(command.ShowOne): """Add a new port interface to the router""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(AddRouterPort, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'port', metavar='<PORT>', help="ID or name of the port to add.", ) parser.add_argument( 'router', metavar='<ROUTER>', help="ID or name of the router.", ) identity_common.add_project_domain_option_to_parser(parser) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network obj = client.find_router(parsed_args.router, ignore_missing=False) body = {} if parsed_args.port and client.find_port(parsed_args.port, ignore_missing=False): body['port_id'] = str(parsed_args.port) client.add_interface_router(obj, **body) return

This commit installs libffi-dev on neutron hosts, and updates the nova

Change-Id: I5a74b313642a1b1c5a6ae8dcb2b883d920b68134

commit_message:
Update test dependencies

This commit installs libffi-dev on neutron hosts, and updates the nova
test dependencies to install on all nova hosts.  This is not causing
gate failures as I believe these packages may already be installed on
the host, and they already exist in containers which is why they do not
fail there.

Change-Id: I5a74b313642a1b1c5a6ae8dcb2b883d920b68134
(cherry picked from commit 703402addb5b1e6a451fbadbb252a181558db459)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/04/301104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: These are typically installed in the repo server where we build the # neutron wheel - name: Install packages required to build neutron python package apt: name: "{{ item }}" with_items: - libffi-dev when: inventory_hostname in groups['neutron_all']

commit_message:
[Debian Fuel] Unrestrict Trusty only

In the current version of fuel-agent, it's impossible to request
anything but Trusty. As a consequence, trying to bootstrap Debian
jessie just fails by design. This patch removes the error, and
also remove the test which checks that nothing else is possible.

Change-Id: I29f901432afe678bbf415830ab71863c744bd25f

commit_message:
zuul: switch system-config to modern puppet-syntax jobs

This patch aims to change how system-config Puppet syntax is verified by
running new jobs that Puppet OpenStack CI is already running for long
time now.
The jobs are validating syntax on Puppet 3 and 4.
²

Change-Id: I3c8cabdf8afaf28d0376f7c769caca926e7df614
